aim.analysis
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • A Basic Analysis Workflow For AIM

Generating summary reports.

Generate both a .PDF and .HTML report with RMarkdown.

report(out.path, project.name, indicator.lut = NULL, benchmarks = NULL,
  analysis = NULL, cats.to.suppress = c("Not Meeting"), point.weights,
  strata.weights, reporting.units.spdf = NULL, sample.frame.spdf,
  project.area.spdf = NULL, points.benchmarked = NULL, dd.points,
  daterange.max = NULL, daterange.min = NULL,
  projection = sp::CRS("+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +datum=WGS84 +no_defs +towgs84=0,0,0"),
  extension = "html")

Arguments

out.path

Character string. The folder path to write the output reports into.
project.name

Character string. The name of the project to be used in the title of the report and the filenames it's written to.
indicator.lut

Data frame. The lookup table between the indicator names in TerrADat and the human readable indicator names.
benchmarks

Data frame. The output from read.benchmarks().
analysis

Data frame. The data frame "analyses" from the output of analyze().
cats.to.suppress

Character vector. One or more categories to suppress in tables. Defaults to c("Not Meeting").
point.weights

Data frame. The data frame point.weights from the output of weight().
strata.weights

Data frame. The data frame strata.weights from the output of weight().
reporting.units.spdf

Spatial polygons data frame. Used in plotting maps. This MUST have a field named exactly "Type" containing the type of reporting unit (e.g. "Watershed" or "Study Area") and a field named exactly "Subpopulation" which contains the identity of the reporting unit[s] (e.g. the watersheds "Dickshooter Creek" and "Headwaters Deep Creek").
sample.frame.spdf

Spatial polygons data frame. Used in plotting maps.
project.area.spdf

Spatial polygons data frame. Used in plotting maps.
points.benchmarked

Data frame. The output from benchmark().
dd.points

Spatial points data frame or list of spatial points data frames. This should be the pts list in the output from read.dd().
daterange.max

Optional character string. This must be interpretable by lubridate::as_date(), e.g. "2016-04-20". Only sampling locations visited before this date will be considered. Currently only restricts to year.
daterange.min

Optional character string. This must be interpretable by lubridate::as_date(), e.g. "2016-04-20". Only sampling locations visited after this date will be considered. Currently only restricts to year.
projection

Optional sp::CRS() argument. Used to convert points.benchmarked into a spatial points data frame. Only specify if points.benchmarked has coordinates not from the same projection as TerrADat. Defaults to sp::CRS("+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +datum=WGS84 +no_defs +towgs84=0,0,0").
extension

Character string. The file extension to write the report to. Defaults to "html".

Contents

  • Arguments

Developed by Nelson G. Stauffer, Steve Garman, Jason Karl.
